title: Compressed List
description:
A virtual compressed list where all elements are of the same type and can be concatenated into a single object of that type. Each list element is expected to be some (conceptual) vector of subelements, such that the concatenated object is also a (conceptual) vector with length equal to the sum of the individual element lengths. The use of a concatenated object improves storage efficiency as list elements can be compressed into a single file.

The partitioning of the concatenated object into individual list elements is described in a data frame, saved as a CSV file under the [**comservatory**](https://ltla.github.io/comservatory) specification. This data frame contains one row per list element and a `number` column that specifies the number of consecutive subelements of the concatenated object that belong in each list element. If `names` is provided, the first column of the data frame contains the names of the list elements.

Concrete subclasses are expected to provide a `concatenated` property that points to the concatenated object.

length.description: Number of entries, specifically the number of groups.

names.description: Names of the entries. This is only provided to facilitate search and may be truncated. Omitted if the input object has no names.

element_data.description: Pointer to a data frame containing additional annotations for each element in the list. If omitted, no additional annotations are present.

other_data.description: Pointer to a list containing additional metadata for this object. Omitted if no additional metadata is available.
